column5: Nicely done! I bet you have a ton of fun the rest of your trip. PjShorthorn.
Couldnt have asked for better weather this opener.fishing was awesome on cedar lake as it usually is.
You will be coming in right after us Jim. We will try to leave a few in Scotty and Dumpy. Water levels have dropped over a foot in the last week though.

I have a friend who has a place north of Ignace where we have been going for the last 9 years on the opener. We fish a number of lakes and always do great getting walleyes and lakers. I haven't been able to sleep because I'm so excited! As my buddy always says; "Life is good in the bush, eh?" Jimmy Mac
everyone is fishing opener and i gotta work nightshift
Mr. Spudder - are you bringing 3 whole potatoes again this year?
Getting to hours and minutes now! When is the season actually begin? Day break or is a time set? Thanks
Good luck to all starting the Walleye opener! Tell us how you did!

Fishing seemed like it was pretty good this morning. Guides and guests all came in with plenty of fish to eat. I don't think anyone was breaking records, but everyone caught plenty to eat. Lots of 16" walleyes, and several over 20" that were released.
Fishing Hawk Lake. Got my 30 for the opener! B-
Congrats, that's a slammer.
Great start! Congratulations! Any one else got pic to share?

Yep, gonna bend my heavy rods with huge pike and maybe even stretch 65# PowerPro line. Hope to run across a couple of 26" pike the first week. In past years have had a tough time getting a lunch under the slot. Anything bigger than 26" won't slime my boat. Appreciate the heads up though. It's good to let others know.
I'll be up there the last week of June
I just made a quick trip south to check the roads out for you Golden Eagle. From exit 212 on I57 to the north end of 502 is clear sailing, road construction is minimal. Welcome home!
Thanks. Is everything in the ground?

Half done, they are waiting on dry weather. Was a quick trip to take care of some business and pick up necessities. Always nice to go down south this time of year, that way I get to see spring come twice.
Come say Hi- I think we would get along!

Next Thursday 2 of my fellow "Buckeyes" and I head north to my nephew's home outside of Milwaukee, and then "dark-thirty" Friday we head north to Vermilion Bay and Cedar Point Resort. Our group has fished the Cedar chain about 8 or so years now, and enjoy the various bays, etc to fish.....Ray & Kathi run a great camp, and have become good friends. It will be hard to get a good night's sleep next Weds evening (ha).....that's not all bad though, as if you can't get excited about fishing the Ontario Spring Opener, well, then it's time to find another sport to enjoy. Faith, Family, Friends......and fishing.... Rich B
the water temp yesterday was 50 degrees i was out the water is low for sure but not any lower then I'm used too in the spring lived here in ear falls for 28 years
water is 50 degrees and low just like normal in spring on lac seul was out yesterday
Good luck.ill be out there to.
We're headed to Woman River. This will be our 5th trip.
Any thoughts on how are the fires going to affect the weather? Heading to South Shore Lodge on Eagle Lake - first time there.
Headed to Nungesser Lake on the 21st!

For me it's the 32nd consecutive walleye opener on the same lake. Had to wait a couple of times for ice to blow away from camp so we could touch down. Has never been less than great. Fishing during time of change is rewarding. Going in May 14 for 2 weeks.
Opener at Wine Lake Camp- 9 days and counting... Fish On! Hooks

fellow fishermen we have 5 driving from Chicago leaving Friday morning 5/27 water levels up relative to last year will be able to go into dumpy and scotty (connecting lakes that have lake trout) looking forward to trip will issue report jim wolf Chicago boys five years ago one of our guys caught a 17# laker (released of course)
Where are you going as the walleye opener in NWO doesnt open till the 21 st.unless your fishing for other species the first week.
Headed to LS on Friday May 20th. Staying on Big Vermillion.
Seal Team 6! We will be up there again as usual. Can't concentrate on anything else at this point.
prov1800, GoldenEagle is fully aware of when the walleye opener is in the Red Lake area and he is going in a week before to chase some pike.
How many of you are going to open the walleye season for the rest of us?! Tell us where and how the fishing and crowds were like! Thanks
We'll be there. Any junior Biologists care to comment on the water temps for NW LS?
We leave next Thursday.....!! Ear Falls bound!
We're heading same way Thursday. Where u staying bushead.
We've been at gold pines since 1996
He is heading for Ghost River for the opener! Id like to give that a try one of these years!
We'll be heading up to Evergreen for opener- getting so pumped!
Will be fishing the opener at Hawk Lake Lodge. Leaving on the 19th. Very excited to be on the water. Might even find a really dumb fish or two...
I was on cliff lake yesterday and main lake was 42 f and found 46-48f in some bays.iam sure lac seul isnt any different. Very, very low water on LS.
Headed to LS and Evergreen for the opener. Maybe we'll have to have a cold one together Knoxabilly
